Headlines: Burundi Quits International Criminal Court
Snippets: It became the first country to withdraw, a month after a U.N. commission called for a criminal inquiry that might lead by to Burundi’s leaders.

Headlines: We’re Not Done Yet, Hague Court Tells Burundi’s Leaders
Snippets: The International Criminal Court opened a criminal investigation into state-sponsored violence, two weeks after the African nation exited the court.

Headlines: U.N. Group Accuses Burundi Leaders of Crimes Against Humanity
Snippets: A panel of investigators set up by the agency’s Human Rights Council said it had delivered a list of suspects to the United Nations High Commissioner for human rights.

Headlines: Burundi Robotics Team Vanishes After U.S. Competition
Snippets: The police say foul play is not suspected in the disappearance of six students from the violence-plagued country. Two were reported seen in Canada.

Headlines: Assassination in Burundi Brings a Vow of Vengeance
Snippets: The environment minister, Emmanuel Niyonkuru, was killed in the first hour of the new year, an act that could exacerbate a nearly two-year political crisis.

Headlines: Jewish Philanthropists Create a Prize for Christian Missionaries
Snippets: “Love the stranger,” says the Torah. So a rabbi’s husband created a $500,000 award for the “superheroes” who provide medical care in Africa.

Headlines: Burundians, Fleeing Political Violence, Find Welcome in Canada
Snippets: It is the final stop in their desperate journey to escape the summary executions, assassinations and torture racking the tiny central African nation.

Headlines: 36 Burundian Refugees Are Shot Dead in Congo
Snippets: The Burundians had fled political violence at home but died in a clash with soldiers, according to the U.N. and a civil society group in Congo.

Headlines: Canada Letter: Spurning Silicon Valley and Rock’s Native Roots
Snippets: A weekly collection of news and analysis about and relevant to Canada.

Headlines: ‘You Cannot Have Peace if You Don’t Listen to Women’
Snippets: Women in Burundi demand a seat at the table.
